Let's talk tech

    Roles and skills

    Owning a startup made me:

    • seek funding
    • do the market research
    • participate in networking activities
    • program websites
    • film videos
    • do social network marketing
    • manage people involved in implementations
    • even go to radio interviews...

    As a freelancer I had to:

    • learn the business of each client
    • deliver fast and frequently
    • be aware and responsible for the quality of my work

    As a part of development teams, I have acted as:

    • Solution architect
    • Tech lead
    • Team lead
    • Mentor to junior developers
    • Scrum master
    • Assistant to product owners
    • Programmer. Yes, I still enjoy doing that.

    Specialty: iOS and Mac

    My specialty is iOS (iPhone, iPad), Mac and its frameworks. As a programmer, I have worked with iOS and Mac development for 9 years now. I am fluent in Swift and Objective-C languages.

    I have published apps on the App Store and Enterprise stores.

    Architecturally I have implemented all common design patterns (MVVM, Coordinator, Customized VIPER, etc), have tinkered, and also added to real projects some of the trendy technologies (rxSwift for example). Have been setting up DevOps parts for CI/CD, Fastlane, Bamboo, and others.

    Mobile future is Flutter

    Flutter is Google developed cross-platform mobile, web, and desktop framework. Together with Emergn team, I have done Flutter evaluation and research. We found it very feasible to use.
